verses.text: My God , my God , why hast thou forsaken me? \add why art thou so\add* far from helping me, \add and from\add* the words of my roaring ?\f + \fr 22.1 \ft Aijeleth…: or, the hind of the morning\f*\f + \fr 22.1 \ft helping…: Heb. my salvation\f* \q1
O my God , I cry in the daytime , but thou hearest not; and in the night season , and am not silent.\f + \fr 22.2 \ft am…: Heb. there is no silence to me\f* \q1
But thou \add art\add* holy , \add O thou\add* that inhabitest the praises of Israel. \q1
Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted , and thou didst deliver them. \q1
They cried unto thee, and were delivered : they trusted in thee, and were not confounded. \q1
But I \add am\add* a worm , and no man ; a reproach of men , and despised of the people. \q1
All they that see me laugh me to scorn : they shoot out the lip , they shake the head , \add saying\add*,\f + \fr 22.7 \ft shoot…: Heb. open\f* \q1

He trusted on the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add that\add* he would deliver him: let him deliver him, seeing he delighted in him.\f + \fr 22.8 \ft He trusted…: Heb. He rolled himself on\f*\f + \fr 22.8 \ft seeing…: or, if he delight in\f* \q1
But thou \add art\add* he that took me out of the womb : thou didst make me hope \add when I was\add* upon my mother’s breasts.\f + \fr 22.9 \ft didst…: or, kept me in safety\f* \q1
I was cast upon thee from the womb : thou \add art\add* my God from my mother’s belly. \b \q1
Be not far from me; for trouble \add is\add* near ; for \add there is\add* none to help.\f + \fr 22.11 \ft none…: Heb. not a helper\f* \q1
Many bulls have compassed me: strong \add bulls\add* of Bashan have beset me round. \q1
They gaped upon me \add with\add* their mouths , \add as\add* a ravening and a roaring lion.\f + \fr 22.13 \ft gaped…: Heb. opened their mouths against me\f* \q1
I am poured out like water , and all my bones are out of joint : my heart is like wax ; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.\f + \fr 22.14 \ft out of…: or, sundered\f* \q1
My strength is dried up like a potsherd ; and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws ; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death. \q1
For dogs have compassed me: the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me: they pierced my hands and my feet. \q1
I may tell all my bones : they look \add and\add* stare upon me. \q1
They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture. \q1
But be not thou far from me, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: O my strength , haste thee to help me. \q1
Deliver my soul from the sword ; my darling from the power of the dog.\f + \fr 22.20 \ft my darling: Heb. my only one\f*\f + \fr 22.20 \ft power: Heb. hand\f* \q1
Save me from the lion’s mouth : for thou hast heard me from the horns of the unicorns. \b \q1
I will declare thy name unto my brethren : in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee. \q1
Ye that fear the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob , glorify him; and fear him, all ye the seed of Israel. \q1
For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted ; neither hath he hid his face from him; but when he cried unto him, he heard. \q1
My praise \add shall be\add* of thee in the great congregation : I will pay my vows before them that fear him. \q1
The meek shall eat and be satisfied : they shall praise the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* that seek him: your heart shall live for ever. \q1
All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee. \q1
For the kingdom \add is\add* the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and he \add is\add* the governor among the nations. \q1
All \add they that be\add* fat upon earth shall eat and worship : all they that go down to the dust shall bow before him: and none can keep alive his own soul. \q1
A seed shall serve him; it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation. \q1
They shall come , and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born , that he hath done \add this\add*.
